name: DCH Blood Spot Outcome PKU SnCT
description: A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system that describes the outcome of the blood spot screening for phenylketonuria.
copyright: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright Â© 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement.

concept.display: Newborn blood spot specimen received
Phenylketonuria screening declined
Phenylketonuria screening declined, no history of being screened
Phenylketonuria screening declined, screened in UK (as reported by parents) with no evidence of result
Phenylketonuria screening declined, screened outside UK with evidence of result
Phenylketonuria screening declined, screened outside UK with no evidence of result
Newborn blood spot screening programme, phenylketonuria repeat screening with further sample required
Phenylketonuria screening, too young for reliable screening
Phenylketonuria screening, sample taken too soon after blood transfusion (less than 72 hours)
Phenylketonuria screening, insufficient sample
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): incorrect blood application
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): compressed/damaged
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample: day 0 and day 5 on same card
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample: NHS number missing/not accurately recorded
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample: date of sample missing/not accurately recorded
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample: date of birth not accurately matched
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample: expired card used
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample: more than 14 days in transit, too old for analysis
Phenylketonuria screening, unsuitable sample: damaged in transit
Phenylketonuria not suspected
Newborn blood spot screening programme, phenylketonuria not suspected and other disorders follow up required
Suspected phenylketonuria
Phenylketonuria not screened for or screening incomplete
Phenylketonuria not screened for or screening incomplete: over 1 year old, too old for screening
Phenylketonuria not screened for or screening incomplete, moved out of area
Phenylketonuria not screened for or screening incomplete, not contactable, reasonable efforts made
Phenylketonuria not screened for or screening incomplete, baby died
Phenylketonuria not screened for or screening incomplete, not required, previous valid result
